sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Laurence Wade OSB, Life of Becket. Canterbury Documents
Laur. Wade. Life of Becket. Canterbury documents
msDesc.p: Paper (and vellum), 262 195 10.3 x 7.8, ff. 56 + 71 + 21 + 4 + 26 + 79, varying numbers of lines to a page. Cent. xvi and xv early, several volumes.

Volume I Cent. xvi early.
Volume II Cent. xvi early, very well written in a Gothic hand.
Volume III Vellum, double columns of 37 lines. Cent. xv early, very well written. Old foliation remaining from 128 to 153.
Volume IV Paper, in Parkerian hands.

msContents.textLang: Latin, Middle English, French and English.
msContents.label: Contents

msItem.head: Laurence Wade OSB, Life of Becket

head.title: The life of Thomas Beckett translated into English verse by Laurence Wade monk of Christ-church Canterbury 1497

ab.quote:
Beginning
O ye virtuous soverayns spiritual and temporal
And all ye devoute people both more and lesse
That thys now shall here hartely I praye yow all
To support my imperfection of lowly gentylnesse
For the lyeff here I purpose with your pacience to reherse
Off seynt Thomas the blissed laureat martir dere
That dyed for the churchys ryght onely in Cristys werre.

msItem.ab:
Eight verses in red:
Herbertum Bosue (i.e. Bosham) virtute virum renitentem
...
Quem cum rore rigent celibe corda pia
Note of the author that his sources are the Thomus of Herbert de Bosham, and the Life by John Grandison
msItem.incipit: O ye vertuous souerayns spirituall and temporall
msItem.rubric: Incipit vita cum actibus gloriosi martiris Thome Cantuariensi archiepiscopi translata a Laurentio Wade claustrali commonacho ecclesie Christi Cantuariensi
De mirabili ortu Sancti Thome secundum Johannem Exoniensem
msItem.incipit: The custome off all holy chirch is laudable and ffamous
msItem.explicit: Recommend hym wnto this blissed saynt that hath shewyd ws her his story. ffinis
msItem.ab: Hardy II 363 prints the prologue, beginning and end. The whole is printed by C. Horstmann in Kölbing's Englische Studien III (1880), pp. 409-469

head.title: Collectanea concerning Christ Church, Canterbury

Collectanea quaedam de archiepiscopis Cantuariensibus praesertim de Lanfranco, Anselmo et Thoma Beckett et de prioribus ecclesiae Christi Cantuariensi  inter quae Gervasius de combustione et edificatione ecclesiae, et Eadmerus ad Glastonienses de corpore Sancti Dunstani

msItem.ab: From William of Malmesbury, Liber III, Polychronicon VIII and gesta Lanfranci
The cope of Gerard de Grauntsouns (Grandson) Bishop of Verdun consecrated 1276 by Kilwarby is preserved
Extract from Geruasius de triplici combustione ecclesiae Cristi Cantuariensi

Verba Sancti Thome cuidam clerico (nomine Thome)
msItem.incipit: Fluxerunt a tempore augustini usque ad normannorum aduentum

Rex Francorum Lodowycus honorabilis fuit archiepiscopo
Hic degit S. Thomas in cenobio Pontiniac

Nota de reliquiae Sancti Audoeni et de incendio Ciuitatis Cantuariensis
msItem.incipit: Predicante augustino cum sociis suis in britannia
msItem.ab: Form of the Archbishop's visiting St Augustine's etc.

Quomodo monachi Sancti Augustini post mortem Lanfranci insurrexerunt contra suum abbatem
Monachos Dorobornensis ecclesiae intromissos in ecclesia Sancti Augustini
De miseria Cantuariensis ecclesiae post mortem Lanfranci
Clerici expelluntur de ecclesia dorobonensi et monachi admittuntur
De translatione Sancti Dunstani secundum opinionem Glastoniensium

The descrypcion of the pageantes made in the cyte of London at the recevyng of the most excellent pryncys Charlys the fyfte emperour and Henry the VIII. king off Englonde

Epistola Edwardi I. ad papam de jure suo in regnum Scotiae
Letter of king Cnut to the English, 1027. Brief chronicle of English affairs from the death of Cnut to the death of Hardicnut

Epistola Canuti regis Angliae scripta Romae, in qua testatur papam concessisse, ut archiepiscopi Angliae non amplius Romam ire cogerentur pallii causa:- cui subjungitur brevis narratio rerum Anglicanarum a morte Canuti ad mortem filii ejus Hardicnuti

msItem.ab: Begins abruptly: huius etiam instantia. The opening words are supplied on the last page of the volume (f. 257v)

Anno regni tricesimo regi Henrici Octavi monasterium Augustini prefatum extra muros Ciuitatis Cantuariensis in festo domini Petri ad vincula dissolutum est et monachi expulsi doctore Leython. Anthonio sentleger et Joh. Moile commissar'
msItem.ab: The latest events noted are in 1540. Chronological order is not kept. The last entry is 1537: surrender of Abingdon Abbey and Boxley Priory, with the rood

head.title: On translating the Bible into English
A determination of a doctor of divinity against them that say it is not lawful to have holy writte and other bookes in Englishe

msItem.incipit: Agaynst theym that say that holy wrytt shulde not be drawen into Englishe
msItem.explicit: and other landes also haue the Bible in their mother tong, as Italy
msItem.ab: At top of f. 65v a space and hec ... ta sunt ex quodam lacero fragmento Bibliothecae Wigorniensis
Text continues: hathe in latin for ţat is her moder tonge and by many yeres haue hade
msItem.explicit: is not ells but ţe habite of right speakinge and right pronouncinge and right writinge
msItem.ab: See Ussher's Historia Dogmatica, s. v. 1410, and MS 100. 3

msItem.head: Nicholas Trevet OP, Quaestiones quodlibetales (extract, I. q. 13)

head.title: Questio determinata per Magistrum Nicolaum dictum Trivet de ordine predicatorum, quod omnia sunt admittenda quae tradit ecclesia circa passionem Christi

msItem.incipit: Questio utrum omnia sint admittenda que tradit ecclesia circa passionem christi
msItem.ab: Deals with the date principally: ends
On f. 79v notes in a good hand on Alfred

seg.ab:
Aluredus rex Anglorum primusque monarchus
Belliger inuictus in scripturis quoque doctus
Aluredus sic recta tenens quod non foret ultra
Rex illi similis vel equalis quoque nullus
Hic a pueritia sua legere ac discere dulce habuit ... in sinu semper circumferebat
Hic sacros apices in linguam anglicam vertere laborabat ... sepultusque est in nouo monasterio Wintonie
Hec ex historia que sic incipit. Eo tempore quo Hely etc.
Another hand: a reference back to article no. 15
seg.incipit: Item in eodem libro rex Canutus romam pergens a Johanne papa
seg.explicit: decreto eiusdem pape cassatum est. huius etiam instantia etc. ut in pagina precedente 40
